alert.note: Alert for Independence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:51AM CDT until March 28 at 11:17AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Batesville affecting Independence County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Batesville. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, A portion of State Highway 14 near Oil Trough may flood. Agricultural land along right bank floods. A crest of 17 feet at the bridge is equivalent to 28 foot crest at the Lock One Tailwater staff gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.5 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date White River Batesville 15.0 11.2 Fri 10 AM 15.5 17.4 13.3 17.5 7 AM 3/26 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
